messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 18-29 years old, female, of White descent. You have some college education and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is your first language. You are 1 feet tall and weighs >200 lbs pounds.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and rarely visits them. You are quite active physically on a weekly basis. Living in the best possible health is very important to you. You are someone who I strongly disagree with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings never. I strongly agree that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I strongly agree that my well-being is good. I strongly disagree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I strongly disagree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I unknown that I am open to experience and imaginative.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I understand basic medical information so I don't need any help but my problem i after talking to the doctor and walking to the waiting room to leave I just forget about all that we talked about so I forget what the doctor tells me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor because she went to school for a very  long time and she knows alot more then I know about anything
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
i'm always worried that I forget what the doctor says after I leave the room and walk to my car. That is all I have to say
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I don't know anything about health issues and I think I'm very healthy because I love walking, and doing challenges on my fitbit

Usually I can understand all health related supjects, at least tell now. When I need a doctor I try first to understand my needs
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
Usually I trust my doctor for respecting his knowledge at least, but still I have some opinions, I will depend on him in severe conditions
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Afraid of having some dangerous condition that may affect my life and work. Thats all nothing more than this
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
It is a family culture taking care of our health, so nothing specific happened, when ever I read new information , I try to understand it

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have a good understanding of my past medical procedures, allergies and current conditions.  I can convey this on the new patient or similar forms so the doctor can get my background.  I try to ask questions of the doctor when he comes up with a recommended treatment plan.  I use email correspondence with my doctor to follow up on any tests or labs. I primarily use Kaiser for my health care which stores all my medical records for easy access to any doctor. In fact, I recently moved to CO from CA, and the new Kaiser physician was able to transfer all my records locally. For prescriptions, I try to read about all the side effects and watch for them.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

He/She has a full record of all my medical history at there fingertips.  They can order new tests and/or labs easily which can often be done in the same facility.  I have had one doctor before moving for over ten years which enabled him to get to know me a bit personally which I think helped the overall care.  This facilitated discussion on lifestyle and care out side the clinic. Often, they new colleagues in the same medical plan that would be a good fit for me in other areas of care such as back doctors or physical therapy.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

The discovery of a new ailment that would lead to new treatments and medicines with uncertain outcome.  You always want to be healthy, but sometimes as you age you are not sure whether something may pop up unexpected.  Also, as you age the number of tests and labs seem to increase. This leads to a time of worry and anxiety to get the results back.  Hopefully, the doctor can put your mind at ease if relevant that the tests are just a precaution. So you do not have to worry while waiting.  Otherwise, you can just try to lead the healthiest life possible and go in to the office confident that you are ok.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was hit and run by a car while riding my bike. I had no radial pulse, lost memory, had multiple broken bones, and was 1mm away from being paralyzed. In addition, my lungs were filling with fluid. I learned a lot about the anatomy of my back, my lungs and what a radial pulse was.  I learned the treatment plans for my conditions and what could be done and what could not be done. Previously, I had no experience in these areas. I had to trust the doctors and what literature they provided to educate myself. It was a long recovery with still remaining issues that I continue to seek treatment and get educated about the body and recovery.

Well i went to the hospital a lot of times when i was young due to my asthma so i have a pretty good idea of the basic information that is given to me. Anything else i would ask questions and look up anything i can online.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
Well my doctor has been seeing me for a while now so he has understanding where i am health wise. I trust his judgement due to his experience and so far its been good.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I think it has to do with the waiting and all the thoughts and ideas that enter my mind. The longer i am waiting the more harder it is to stay calm. Feeling anxious and wanting to get it over with.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I remember when i was young and i got my first asthma attack and i couldn't breathe. I spent the next 3-4 days in the hospital because of it and i learned a few things about the process.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor as she listens to my concerns and addresses them with testing and the specialist I need. I have became better health wise since being under this doctors care
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When I have symptoms associated with diseases that are tough to treat. I have lung disease so especially worried when I get a infection
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I had cervical spine surgery. The surgeon explained everything in full so I naturally had a little fear as it was my spinal cord they were  operating on

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Doctors don't really seem to take their time with the patients, that's usually the nurses job, so they don;t seem to care too much or the cherry-picked the patients they went to care about..and I generally don't just anyone that pushes unnecessary medications and treatment on their patients so they can line their pockets or an money for their hospital.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I'm not worried just cautious and aware..educated...

I just do a lot of research. I read a lot of books on medicine, illnesses and the medical profession and ethics. I watch a lot of documentaries on the topic also and my mother was a nurse.

Them finding something wrong with me that I have no control over. Finding something in a test and their is no cure.

once again i know how to trust the doctors because when I was young my mom and dad taught me everything I need to know about how to talk to my doctor and stuff.

nothing because I trust that my life is in good hands with my doctor so there is no use trying to worry myself and have worse nerves than i need for nothing

none because I have not needed to go to the doctor for any serious issue so I am still healthy and do not need to see to my health for now.

I am capable of obtaining, processing, and understanding basic health information and services to make appropriate health decisions. I have a doctoral degree in pharmacy.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care doctor because he will refer me to a specialist if he is unaware of anything. I trust my ob gyn because he is knowledgeable, easy to talk to, respectful, he listens, he gives me options. Both my physicians listen and do research.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am worried when I visit the doctor's office because I have numerous health issues. I'm usually afraid that something will be wrong. I feel better after speaking with my doctors regardless of the outcome of my exam, labs, etc.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I'm a hospital pharmacist with a doctoral degree. Although I'm in management, I precept students and I train Pharmacists in clinical areas such as kinetics, antimicrobial stewardship, etc.

I believe that I understand most of what my health providers tell me. When I'm uncertain, I search for more information. I have sought out a second medical opinion in the past.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

She never seems rushed with me, and she will always take the time to research an issue to make sure she's considered every possible solution. There was a time when I felt her treatment recommendation was too drastic, but she had no problem referring me to a specialist.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

With some health care providers in the past, I felt that they were too rushed and a little rough. During my first pregncy, I saw one doctor in the practice who gave me a quick, rough interl exam. Even my husband was cringing. When a doctor's bedside manner is impersol and they seem rushed for time, it usually makes me feel nervous, and I am much less likely to ask questions, lest I annoy the doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A friend had been given antibiotic eye drops for her son's pink eye. She told me that in the past they had worked well, but this time they were not working as quickly. I asked if her son had recently had a cold, and she said yes. I told her that some pink eye is viral, in which case the eye drops will not help.

Nothing in particular causes these feelings. I just do not care for going to a doctor. It's a sense of waiting I dislike.

I worked in the medical field many years ago. Things may not be quite accurate. Medical technology is more advance.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my PCP because she is caring and expresses concern about my health. She listens to my needs and concerns and we have an open discuss about what works best for me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing makes me feel anxious or worried about visiting the doctor. We discuss my health and any issues I may gave and the best options for me.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I understand that obesity has severe consequences on your overall health. Heart disease, hypertension, and stroke are a few of the health issues related to obesity

My doctor takes the time to listen and help me she doesn't try to rush you out the door. When she isn't familiar with an issue she will find out about it and then help you

I always get anxious when I go to the doctor because I don't go there very often. It not a bad anxious it don't cause me problems or ruin my day

I have had to take care of my mother who had meboltic syndrome and my son had many health issues growing up

I think I have all the means necessary to get my questions answered. I can google anything and I'm not afraid to ask a million questions if that's what it takes to understand the condition or issue.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor always answers all of my questions and has never steered my wrong. I'm never rushed and am always number one when I'm in the room with her.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing really makes me feel anxious or worried when I'm visiting the doctor. I know I'm there to get checked out and I'll take the next step as it comes.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My daughter fell off of a scooter and cut her leg open. There was a lot of blood pouring out onto the concrete. I knew that I needed to apply pressure to get the bleeding to stop and get her to immediate care as quickly as possible. She got 5 stitches in her knee.
